concept.title: Test dl
concept.shortdesc: This document should test various attribute values on DL, along with odd combinations of multiple terms/defns.

dlentry.dd: dl, only one dlentry

conbody.p: Now, try to repeat that through conref:

p.b: Basic DL with no attributes, no header, single terms, single defn's

dlentry.dd: This is a number that starts the numeribet (sort of like an alphabet, but with numbers). It is nearly impossible to define, because you could spend years simply meditating on the idea of "one" and what it might mean in the overall scheme of the universe.
Alternate definition: Neo in the Matrix.
This number is not nearly as exciting as one.

Ah, now three is not as important as one, or as exciting, but it is far superious to two. Many things come in threes; good things, bad things, and average things. In addition, I once found three rocks that looked like carrots. There they were, all lined up in a row and painted orange.
the outputclass attribute
here is an entry
here is an entry
here is an entry
here is an entry

This is a number that starts the numeribet (sort of like an alphabet, but with numbers). It is nearly impossible to define, because you could spend years simply meditating on the idea of "one" and what it might mean in the overall scheme of the universe.
This number is not nearly as excitng as one.

Ah, now three is not as important as one, or as exciting, but it is far superious to two. Many things come in threes; good things, bad things, and average things. In addition, I once found three rocks that looked like carrots. There they were, all lined up in a row and painted orange.

p.b: Test multiple definitions, multiple terms in a single dlentry:

dlentry.dd: short definition
short definition
short definition
These are terms which have definitions

These are also terms which have definitions. The definitions here must be longer because I want to test wrapping and because boy I really do enjoy typing things that have no relevance to anything at all because after all they are just letters and things like that but fortunately I type fast so it doesn't take long to fill up a paragraph.
These are terms which have definitions

conbody.p: DL with single terms, and multiple definitions:

dlentry.dd: short definition

Long definition: The definitions here must be longer because I want to test wrapping and because boy I really do enjoy typing things that have no relevance to anything at all because after all they are just letters and things like that but fortunately I type fast so it doesn't take long to fill up a paragraph.
another short definition

A thing which grows. The definitions here must be longer because I want to test wrapping and because boy I really do enjoy typing things that have no relevance to anything at all because after all they are just letters and things like that but fortunately I type fast so it doesn't take long to fill up a paragraph.
A thing which may or may not be green.
A thing that connects stuff
a thing that transmits stuff

concept.title: Everything in a DL
concept.shortdesc: This should test everything that can go in DT, DD, and their headers.

dlhead.dthd: Testing dthd: test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cmdname test codeph test filepath test italic test inline image: test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state -> ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle
dlhead.ddhd: Testing ddhd: test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cmdname test codeph test filepath test italic test inline image: test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state -> ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle

dlentry.dd: simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn.

Any defn should of course start with basic text. Followed by other stuff. As for the other stuff, we'll put phrase-level stuff first. test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cite test cmdname test codeph test filepath test footnote test italic test inline image: test indexterm test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph [skipping object] test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state -> ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term tm to amazon test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle test xref to the top Now let's test block-level stuff:
simple defn. codeblock codeblock codeblock

simple defn. nest to place one dl inside of another. This might be possible when your definition is so confusing that it needs its own definition. That's silly, huh?
nest to place one dl inside of another. This might be possible when your definition is so confusing that it needs its own definition. That's silly, huh?
simple defn. add a draft-comment here

simple defn. figure in a definition
this is my figure, it is in a DL i mean in a DLENTRY i mean in a DD
simple defn. this is an itemgroupfollowed by another itemgroup
simple defn. lines lines and more lines

simple defn. Test lq: [A] co-op board on the West Side of Manhattan has forbidden new buyers to smoke in their apartments, a restriction that real estate experts called the first of its kind in the nation.
simple defn. msgblock msgblock (msgnum, varname) msgblock
simple defn. Add a note to my definitionAdd attention to my definitionAdd caution to my definitionAdd danger to my definition

simple defn.
one ol
two ol
one ul
two ul

simple defn.
add a paragraph
and another paragraph
simple defn. Parml: pt pd
simple defn. my pre is a good pre don't you think
simple defn. i require that you clean this up

dlentry.dt: test varname | wintitle | xref to the top test
dlentry.dd: simple defn. Try a couple of table models, simple + complex:

Simple table --
one stentry two stentry
one stentry two stentry

complex table: table in a DDthis is a table in a DD
a complex
table is here

simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn. simple defn.
to test screen: Screens keep the house cool or cold if you forget to take them down for winter
